meanings.definition: A type of crustacean with leaf-like appendages.
meanings.sent1: The phyllopods scuttled along the ocean floor, their leafy legs propelling them forward.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study phyllopods to learn more about their unique leaf-shaped limbs.
meanings.sent3: The phyllopods decided to have a race to see whose leafy legs were the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The phyllopods danced gracefully, their phyllopod legs moving like delicate leaves in the wind.
meanings.sent5: In the dim light of the deep sea, the phyllopods' phyllopods shimmered like underwater foliage.

meanings.definition: The plural form of phyllopod, referring to multiple leaf-like appendages.
meanings.sent1: A group of phyllopods gathered at the edge of the pond, their leafy limbs rustling in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The exhibit showcased various phyllopods, each with its own unique set of leafy extensions.
meanings.sent3: The phyllopods held a meeting to discuss the best way to camouflage their leafy legs.
meanings.sent4: The forest floor was covered in a carpet of fallen leaves, resembling a bed of phyllopods.
meanings.sent5: As the wind blew through the trees, the phyllopods' phyllopods swayed gently, creating a mesmerizing sight.
